programme.title: Call of the Forest
programme.desc: A young boy's camaraderie with wild animals comes in handy when he sets out to avenge his father's death.

programme.title: Abilene Town
programme.desc: A saloon singer (Ann Dvorak) and her rival like a marshal (Randolph Scott) who cleans up a drunken sheriff's (Edgar Buchanan) cow town.

programme.title: Raiders of the Border
programme.desc: U.S. marshals (Johnny Mack Brown, Raymond Hatton) catch rustlers swapping cattle for Mexican jewels.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: Pat and Stoney are ordered to break up a safe cracking gang preying on Colorado banks handling government silver bullion.

programme.title: Cowboy G-Men
programme.desc: US mint has been buying silver diluted with lead; Pat and Scotty set out to find the criminals.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.sub-title: Is There a Doctor in the Roundhouse?
programme.desc: Curtis breaks the throttle of the Cannonball and blocks the way to Kate's jamboree.

programme.title: Petticoat Junction
programme.desc: Kate tries to restore the self confidence of Floyd Smoot after he is jilted by his mail-order sweetheart, by pretending to be in love with him.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A crooked stagecoach driver accuses Cisco and Pancho of stealing $50,000 from him.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A prominent investment broker is captured after scheming to have two of his men impersonate Cisco and Pancho at a bank hold-up.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Elected as mayor, an outlaw deputizes members of his gang.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: A killer escapes from prison and tries to reunite with his girlfriend.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: A young boy runs away from home because his father doesn't stand up to his abusive boss.

programme.title: Judge Roy Bean
programme.desc: A woman arrives in town looking for her son; Roy finds out that her son is not only in the area, but has become a notorious outlaw.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: An outlaw keeps his convict brother from going straight.

programme.title: Annie Oakley
programme.desc: Annie (Gail Davis) has hopes of acquiring a prime piece of land in a newly opened territory. With Douglas Kennedy, James Griffith.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: A young lieutenant seeks blind vengeance for the brutal murders of his parents by warmongering Shawnee.

programme.title: Hawkeye and the Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Hawkeye and Chingachcook match their wits against two thieves who have phony identities.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: A former dance hall girl poses as a Spanish heiress to claim a land grant that includes part of the Ponderosa; guest Sebastian Cabot.

programme.title: Prairie Pals
programme.desc: Deputies must save a scientist from kidnappers.

programme.title: New Mexico
programme.desc: After the Civil War, cavalryman Capt. Hunt tries to strike peace with Acoma, a Native American chief. However, Judge Wilcox and others provoke Acoma, arresting him and shooting his men, prompting revenge from the chief.

programme.title: Six-Gun Trail
programme.desc: Posing as an Asian, a Washington agent goes after a gem-smuggling outlaw gang.

programme.title: Colorado
programme.desc: Lieutenant Jerry Burke (Roy Rogers) is sent to Colorado to track down a troublesome gang. When he finally catches them, he finds out his traitorous brother commands them.

programme.title: Under California Stars
programme.desc: Returning to his California ranch for some rest and relaxation, cowboy movie star Roy Rogers (Roy Rogers) finds himself drawn into battle with a dastardly group of horse rustlers.

programme.title: The Lawless Frontier
programme.desc: A cowboy (John Wayne) protects a girl (Sheila Terry) and her father (George Hayes) from a rustler and a sheriff.

programme.title: American Empire
programme.desc: Three men (Richard Dix, Leo Carrillo, Preston Foster) start a big cattle ranch in post-Civil War Texas, but greed destroys it.

programme.title: The Painted Desert
programme.desc: A tungsten miner (Bill Boyd) loves his father's rival's daughter (Helen Twelvetrees) and fights off her other suitor (Clark Gable).

programme.title: Across the Plains
programme.desc: A man (Jack Randall) raised by Indians fights his long-lost brother raised by the outlaws who killed their parents.

programme.title: A Lust to Kill
programme.desc: A marshal (Jim Davis) uses an outlaw's (Don Megowan) girlfriend (Allison Hayes) as bait to lure him into a showdown.

programme.title: Law of the Pampas
programme.desc: Hopalong Cassidy (William Boyd) and his sidekick (Russell Hayden) head for South America to deliver cattle.
